What about helping deer detect cars?

Deer seem to have no trouble finding cars.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2022-10-13T15:13:21.900Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":83.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":416081,"topic_slug":"could-limelight-help-deer-detect-hunters-5826-asks-the-important-questions","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32535,"username":"wgorgen","name":"wgorgen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wgorgen/{size}/10106_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/could-limelight-help-deer-detect-hunters-5826-asks-the-important-questions/416081/3","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3088679,"name":"tjwolter - Mentor, supply clerk and chief janitor Team 5826","username":"tjwolter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tjwolter/{size}/131306_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-13T15:32:38.618Z","cooked":"

Deer have incredible hearing, vision, sense of smell…if they deployed their entire sensor suite all the time, and had a bit more on board processing power, hunters would never see them. Of course they only are as smart as they “need” to be. And they get a lot smarter quickly as hunting season progresses.

The issue with cars is that the learning curve is really, really steep! Like, vertical.
